title: The Aging Brain Care Virtual Program
description_brief: The program involves a virtual intervention to be delivered by RN or SW care coordinators over one year. Every care partner will receive monthly virtual visits during the first 3 months and then quarterly or more depending on assessed need. The intervention relies on a tailored approach in which patient and caregiver needs are identified during visits using validated assessment tools and addressed with standardized protocols. Protocols include management of behavioral/psychological symptoms of dementia, caregiver stress, medication management, comorbidity management and advance care planning.
explanation_target: Reason: The described intervention is a 12-month, virtual care‑coordination program delivered by RN or social‑work care coordinators that uses validated assessment tools and standardized protocols to address behavioral/psychological symptoms of dementia, caregiver stress, medication and comorbidity management, and advance care planning. This is a non‑pharmacologic, psychosocial/care coordination intervention focused on managing neuropsychiatric and behavioral symptoms and caregiver burden rather than targeting Alzheimer’s pathology with a drug. citeturn0search7turn0search1

Act: No drug is mentioned in the trial description (the intervention is labeled 'Behavioral: Aging Brain Care Virtual Program' and the study is registered NCT06245499). Therefore there is no biologic or small‑molecule agent to identify; the correct match among the provided categories is 'neuropsychiatric symptom improvement' because the protocols explicitly include management of behavioral/psychological symptoms of dementia and caregiver stress. citeturn0search1turn0search7

The best fit is 'neuropsychiatric symptom improvement'. No ambiguity remains given the trial text and registered protocol. citeturn0search7turn0search1
